questions.question: In which year did Pakistan gain independence?
questions.feedback: Pakistan gained independence from British rule on August 14, 1947.

questions.question: Who is known as the founder of Pakistan?
questions.feedback: Quaid-e-Azam Muhammad Ali Jinnah is known as the founder of Pakistan and served as its first Governor-General.

questions.question: Who was Pakistan's first Prime Minister?
questions.feedback: Liaquat Ali Khan served as Pakistan's first Prime Minister from 1947 until his assassination in 1951.

questions.question: When did Pakistan become a nuclear power?
questions.feedback: Pakistan conducted its nuclear tests in May 1998, becoming the world's 7th nuclear power.

questions.question: Which historical resolution called for the creation of Pakistan?
questions.feedback: The Lahore Resolution of 1940, also known as the Pakistan Resolution, formally called for the creation of independent Muslim states.
